Privacy Policy
Privacy Policy
Effective Date: July 1, 2021
Last Updated on: July 1, 2021

We value your privacy and have created this privacy policy (“Privacy Policy” or “Policy”) to outline our policies for collecting, using, and disclosing Personal Data when you use our service on our Platform, as well as your options for dealing with that data. Your information is used to provide and improve the Service. By using the Service, you agree to the processing of your Personal Data as outlined in this Policy. If there are any terms in this Privacy Policy that you do not agree with, please discontinue use of our Services immediately. This Privacy Policy applies to all information collected through our Services (which includes our Website, App, Chrome Extension, Slack App, and Zoom App), as well as, any related services, sales, marketing or events. By visiting any of our Platforms, you are providing your acceptance and consent to practices outlined here.
What do we collect and how do we collect it?
What do we collect and how do we collect it?

When you are using our Services, we collect information that you voluntarily provide to us when you register for our Services or when you access or surf through our Platforms, or express an interest in obtaining information about us or our products or Services or otherwise when you contact us, some which may be considered as personal data and can be used to identify you. All personal information that you provide to us must be true, complete and accurate, and you must notify us of any changes to such personal information.

The personal information we collect may include names, phone numbers, email addresses, contacts, company and your job title, and other similar information. We may give you the option of registering with us using the information from your existing social media accounts, such as Facebook, Twitter, or other social media accounts. We will gather the information described if you opt to register in this manner. If you decide to login using your third-party social media account details, we will receive certain information about you from your social media provider. The profile information we collect varies depending on the social media network, and it includes your name, email address, friends list, profile image, and any other information you want to make public on that platform. We will only use the information we collect for the purposes indicated in this Privacy Policy or as otherwise specified on the relevant Services. Please keep in mind that we have no control over and are not responsible for how your third-party social media provider handles your personal information. We recommend reading their privacy notice to learn how they collect, use, and disclose your personal information, as well as how to control your privacy settings on their websites and apps.

There are information’s which are automatically collected by us – such as your internet protocol (IP) address and / or browser and device characteristics, operating system, language preference, referring URLs, country, location, and other technical information. It is collected automatically when you visit, use or navigate through our Platforms. This information is largely used to keep our Services secure and operational, as well as for internal analytics and reporting.

We also collect information through cookies and similar technologies. Cookies are files with small amount of data which may include an anonymous unique identifier. Cookies are sent to your browser from a website and stored on your device. We and our Service Providers also use beacons and tags in HTML emails to our customers to help us track email response rates, identify when our emails are viewed, and track whether our emails are forwarded. You can instruct your browser to refuse all cookies or to indicate when a cookie is being sent. However, if you do not accept cookies, you may not be able to use some portions of our Service.
We collect information regarding your mobile device, push notifications, when you use our App.
How do we use your data?
How do we use your data?

Primarily, we use the information we collect about you to provide you with a more personalized experience and to answer to any requests you send us in a more thorough manner. We use the data or information we receive or collect to:
a)          For setting up and creation of your account.
b)          Identify you on our system and to keep track of the Services.
c)          To notify you about changes to our Service.
d)          To allow you to participate in interactive features of our Service when you choose to do so.
e)          To provide customer support.
f)           To gather information to improve our website / app and Service.
g)          To monitor usage of our Service.
h)          To detect, prevent and address technical issues.

i)           To provide you with news, latest updates, special offers, general information about our other products, services which we offer that are similar to those that have already been subscribed by you unless you have opted not to receive such information.
j)           To request feedback.
k)          To enforce our terms, conditions and policies for business purposes, to comply with legal and regulatory requirements, or in connection with our contract.

l)           When we believe, it is required to investigate, prevent, or take action in connection with any illegal activity, suspected fraud, circumstances involving potential threats to anyone's safety, or violations of our Terms of Service or this Privacy Policy.
How do we store your data?
How do we store your data?

We will retain your Personal Data for as long as it is required to fulfill the purposes outlined in this Privacy Policy. We will keep and use your Personal Data to the extent necessary to comply with our legal duties (for example, if relevant laws compel us to keep your data), resolve disputes, and enforce our legal agreements and policies. Your data might be kept for internal analysis as well. Except where this data is used to reinforce the security or to improve the functionality of our Service, or we are legally compelled to maintain this data for extended periods of time, we will keep usage data for a shorter length of time.
Will your information be shared with anyone?
Will your information be shared with anyone?

We only share information with your consent, to comply with laws, to provide you with services, to protect your rights, or to fulfil business obligations. Your information, including Personal Data, may be transferred to— and maintained on — computers located outside of your state, province, country or other governmental jurisdiction where the data protection laws may differ than those from your jurisdiction. Your consent to this Privacy Policy followed by your submission of such information represents your agreement to that transfer.
We may process or share your data that we hold based on the following legal basis:
a)          Business Interest. We may process your data when it is reasonably necessary to achieve our legitimate business interests.
b)          Performance of a Contract. Where we have entered into a contract with you, we may process your personal information to fulfil the terms of our contract.

c)          Legal Obligations. We may disclose your information where we are legally required to do so in order to comply with applicable law, governmental requests, a judicial proceeding, court order, or legal process, such as in response to a court order or a subpoena (including in response to public authorities to meet national security or law enforcement requirements).

d)          Vital Interests. We may disclose your information where we believe it is necessary to investigate, prevent, or take action regarding potential violations of our policies, suspected fraud, situations involving potential threats to the safety of any person and illegal activities, or as evidence in litigation in which we are involved.

e)          Business Transfers. We may share or transfer your information in connection with, or during negotiations of, any merger, sale of company assets, financing, or acquisition of all or a portion of our business to another company.

f)           Vendors, Consultants and Other Third-Party Service Providers. We may share your data with third-party vendors, Service Providers, contractors or agents who perform services for us or on our behalf and require access to such information to do that work. We may allow selected third parties to use tracking technology on the Services, which will enable them to collect data on our behalf about how you interact with our Services over time. This information may be used to, among other things, analyse and track data, determine the popularity of certain content, pages or features, and better understand online activity. Unless described in this notice, we do not share, sell, rent or trade any of your information with third parties for their promotional purposes.
How do we keep your informations safe?
How do we keep your informations safe?

We've put in place necessary technical and organisational security measures to protect the privacy of any Personal Data we handle. However, no electronic transmission over the Internet or information storage technique can be guaranteed to be 100 percent secure, so we cannot promise or guarantee that hackers, cybercriminals, or other unauthorised third parties will not be able to circumvent our security and improperly gather, access, steal, or modify your data. Although we will do our best to protect your personal information, you are responsible for transmitting personal information to and from our Services.
Sensitive Personal Data
Sensitive Personal Data

If you provide us with sensitive information in the course of interacting with the system, we will only use sensitive information for the purpose of storing and processing it as part of our Services. Sensitive information may include information about you such as racial or ethnic origin, religious beliefs, political affiliation, sexual preferences and criminal records, as well as health and genetic information about you. If you do not consent to the processing and storing of your sensitive information, it is therefore important that it not be submitted to us in the course of your usage.
Do we collect information from minors?
Do we collect information from minors?

We do not knowingly solicit data from children under the age of 18 years or market to them. By using the Services, you signify that you are at least 18 years old or that you are the parent or guardian of a minor dependent who consents to the use of the Services by that minor dependent. If we learn that personal information from users less than 18 years of age has been collected, we will deactivate the account and take reasonable measures to promptly delete such data from our records. If you become aware of any data, we may have collected from children under age 18, please contact us at support@loopinhq.com.
International Transfers
International Transfers

Loopin processes Personal Data in the USA and other countries. If you are a resident of UK or the European Economic Area and if your Personal Data is processed outside UK or the EEA, Loopin will endeavour to ensure that the recipient of your Personal Data offers an adequate level of protection.
Are any updates made to the Privacy Policy?
Are any updates made to the Privacy Policy?

We periodically update this Privacy Policy. In the event of an update, we will post the new policy at www.loopinhq.com/privacy-policy and update the “Last Updated” date above. Please check this page regularly for updates.
How can you reach us?
How can you reach us?
If you have questions or comments about this notice, you may email us at support@loopinhq.com.
How can you review, update or delete the data we collect from you?
How can you review, update or delete the data we collect from you?

In some cases, you may have the right to seek access to, amend, or delete the personal information we collect from you, depending on the laws in your country. Please email to support@loopinhq.com to seek a review, modification, or deletion of your personal information. We may take 30 days to respond to your request.
Service Provider
Service Provider

We may employ third party companies and individuals to perform functions on our behalf, including to facilitate our Service ("Service Providers"), to provide the Service on our behalf, to perform Service-related services or to assist us in analysing how our Service is used. These third parties have access to your Personal Data only to perform these tasks on our behalf and are obligated not to disclose or use it for any other purpose.
What are your Data Protection Rights?
What are your Data Protection Rights?
We would like to ensure that you are fully aware of your data protection rights. Every user is entitled to the following:
a)          The right to access the copies of your Personal Data with us. We may charge you a small fee for this.
b)          The right to rectification of your information or data you believe is incorrect, by submitting adequate proofs.
c)          The right to erasure of your Personal Data, under certain conditions and terms of the Company.
d)          The right to restrict processing of your Personal Data by us under certain conditions.
e)          The right to data portability we have collected to another organization, or directly to you, under certain conditions.
